title: Accelerated Field Tests

author: Leif Wiman, Swedish National Road and Transport Research Institute - VTI

segmentation: Yes, I I.
My presentation is about the accelerated loading test that was performed in Slovenia.
So you have my name in it.
From Sweden.
And the content of my presentation is.
Description of the machine itself.
The heavy vehicle simulator HS and how we come through Europe.
The transportation through Europe and something about the procedure for the testing.
And finally some example of the measurements that was carried out during the test.
Tests.
This is how it looks like in principle.
There is that the loading wheel is inside the frame and it goes forward and back forward and back 724 hours a day and seven days a week if you want.
That means about two 25,000 loadings a day.
And the frame can move in the lateral way inside way in steps of five centimeters.
So you can simulate the real traffic lateral wonder.
And I have just 10 minutes, so I have to go through this rather fast.
This is just pictures of the loading.
We the left side is single wheel and right one is the dual wheel.
But you can't see it.
And then this is a climb.
Red box in insulating books that make it possible to have the hell the temperature constant urine the test.
So there is equipment for heating and cooling inside to keep the air temperature constant, and we measure the temperature in the.
Aspect.
And you have sent said.
Seen this picture before we went from VTi in Sweden to Slovenia and Poland and back to Sweden and it was in April last year.
And then this is picture from the when we arrived to Germany by boat and then by car or track through Europe and finally at the test site at dirocco drug drug Drug Java.
Outside my reboot.
And then I come to the.
The procedure for the test and this is from these tests.
Right?
And that she had seen before.
There is 3 test fields with six structures and the HPS Murphy machine was placed between two structures.
Which means that the two structures were loaded at the same time.
I didn't say that the length of the test area is 8 meters, but we'll have to stop and return at the end.
So the real test length is 6 meters.
That means that 3 meters of each structure were loaded.
And you have heard, and the test is mainly with different thickness of the asphalt layer.
And the test parameters we used in Slovenia was jewel will for all tests and at the first Test with structure one and two we only use 60 kilometer turn.
But in structure three and four we raised increased the load 280 kilonewtons after two days.
So testing and at the last Test structure five and six we even.
Raise the load to 100 at the end of the test.
The tire pressure was kept constant in at all loads.
And the size of the ties are normal track ties, so in this case that you will.
Weed.
And the speed is about 12 kilometers an hour and loading in both directions is it's possible to make it just in one, but then you lose half of the loadings.
The declaration is less.
And we there was chosen the payment temperature at 20 degrees in these tests.
And I told you about the lateral load distribution we used.
Distribution as we did improve.
And also, and this is the load distribution, then the persons of loadings in each position or 5 centimeters.
So 1/3 of the loading.
Sorry in the center line, but as it is and dual wheel the wheel is about half a meter.
If you include both wheels.
So when it's in the center line the wheels are outside the center line.
And then here you can see when we change the load on the different tests.
first Test was just 60 kilonewtons up to almost 300,000 loadings, and at the test two and three and the load was increased after two days at 50,000 loadings.
And at the last Test we raise it at the end of the test, just the last day you almost.
And.
The measurements during the test we call it performance measurements and response measurements.
Performance measurements is what we can see on the surface and in this case we look for wrapping and cracking, but we didn't see any correct, so it was just wrapping.
And the response measurement is measured by sensors inside the payment.
And this picture shows the rotting in example of rotting in one section, and you can see the number of loadings to the right.
And the increase of directing.

In the in the autumn 2007, with the period for the construction and at that time we did the installation of the sensors and this is the EMU coils that Voigt shows if the inductive chords which is placed at the bottom in this case in the bottom of the Bay, unbound based layer and at the top of the layer above each other and it works.
With the magnetic field, so there is currency on one or the other of the course and the other.
Got induction from the magnetic field and we can measure the distance between these calls.
And also the change in thickness and got the deformation of the layer in that way.
And at the bottom of the asphalt layer we measure the asphalt strain.
It's the same way as in Poland.
And with this strain gauges that was placed on the top of the unbound base layer an before paving.
And to protect these sensors, we did some protection by hand.
Just to make sure that they didn't influenced by the paving.
And changed.
Position.
And this is the.
In longitudinal view of the instrumentation in the center line.
And you can see.
The pink pink can I use it?
Yeah, this is the the string gauges at the bottom of the asset layer.
And this is the inductive coils.
Measuring the distance between them.
And this is an example of the results from these measurements, the number of loadings and the average rap tips on each structure.
In this case it's structure 4 and you can see the deformation of the onboard base layer and rusting or deformation on the surface.
And you can see the effect of increasing the load at 50,000.
Loadings.
And this is the example of the output from the strain gauges.
It just rains in the asphalt.
And we make records from 4 loadings, two in each direction.
And sometimes we got some difference in the top values, so the values we have used is the average of these four.
And this is the last picture.
Shows spell strain.
At the start of the test and at the end of the test as a function of.
Increasing load.
And this is the start of the test.
And this is at the end of the test.
And the strain does not.
Increase as much as the load and that.
One explanation is that we use the same tire pressure for overloads.
I mean that means with high loads and in the same tire pressure you have got deformation of the tire and the contact area increases.
That's the explanation.
Excuse me, that was my best picture.
Thank you.
